meanings.sent1: In the play, the nonactors played the roles of townspeople.
meanings.sent2: The movie featured a mix of professional actors and nonactors.
meanings.sent3: The nonactors in the film accidentally stole the spotlight from the main cast.
meanings.sent4: The nonactors on set added a sense of authenticity to the scene.
meanings.sent5: During the audition, the director specifically sought out nonactors for certain roles.

meanings.definition: Those who do not perform in theatrical productions.
meanings.sent1: The nonactors in the audience enjoyed the show just as much as the performers.
meanings.sent2: The theater group welcomed both actors and nonactors to join their workshops.
meanings.sent3: The nonactors decided to put on their own play in the community center.
meanings.sent4: The stage manager appreciated the dedication of the nonactors who helped with props.
meanings.sent5: During the intermission, the nonactors mingled with the cast members backstage.

meanings.definition: Individuals who are not involved in acting.
meanings.sent1: The nonactors in the room listened intently to the director's instructions.
meanings.sent2: At the acting workshop, the focus was on helping nonactors feel comfortable on stage.
meanings.sent3: The nonactors at the party were surprised when asked to participate in a spontaneous skit.
meanings.sent4: The film crew appreciated the nonactors' enthusiasm during the shoot.
meanings.sent5: The nonactors in the group photo stood out among the seasoned actors.
